definition: to overthrow/downfall/to fall from power/to go bankrupt
to fall/to collapse/to lie horizontally/to overthrow/to fail/to go bankrupt/to change (trains or buses)/to move around/to resell at a profit
to place upside down/to invert/to pour/to throw out/to move backwards/however/actually/as a matter of fact/contrary to expectation

sentences.english: The American authorities decided to let Lehman fail pour encourager les autres.
sentences.chinese: 美國當局決定殺一儆百讓雷曼兄弟倒臺。

sentences.english: Education has been revitalized after the fall of the Taliban.
sentences.chinese: 教育在塔利班倒臺之後重生。

sentences.english: Many Cubans welcomed the fall of the Batista government.
sentences.chinese: 很多古巴人對巴蒂斯塔政權倒臺表示歡迎。

sentences.english: so I am campaigning for the downfall of evil throughout the universe. Yeah.
sentences.chinese: 所以我在爭取全宇宙邪惡勢力的倒臺，是的。

sentences.english: The junta fell less than a year later.
sentences.chinese: 不到一年後，軍政府即告倒臺。

sentences.english: It comes amid concern about the possibility of fragmentation of rebel forces after toppling Col Gaddafi.
sentences.chinese: 此言是爲了平抑大家對於卡倒臺後義軍分裂的憂慮。

sentences.english: Various factors contributed to his downfall.
sentences.chinese: 多種因素的作用導致了他的倒臺。

sentences.english: The Prodi government has fallen in this chamber.
sentences.chinese: 在這個議院裏，普羅迪政府已經倒臺了。

sentences.english: In the wake of Lehman Brothers' failure, emerging markets have suffered one of their biggest sell-offs in years.
sentences.chinese: 隨着雷曼的倒臺，新興市場經歷了今年最大的拋售。

sentences.english: The Taliban's overthrow in 2001 seemed to open the door to new opportunity.
sentences.chinese: 2001年塔利班的倒臺似乎爲巴米揚開了機會之門。
該政府終於在一九七零年倒臺了。
